info.title: OpenDI Decision Modeling API
info.description:
This WIP API specification intends to define standard endpoints that OpenDI-compliant systems are expected to provide or utilize.  
This specification's primary goal is to align an ecosystem of vendors, researchers, educators, and other users around a shared interoperability framework.



This API largely concerns [Causal Decision Models](api/models.tag.mdx) and other related data structures used to model, simulate, and visualize decisions.

## More info

 For more on the motivation behind this effort, see the OpenDI homepage.  
[View Resource >>](https://opendi.org/)

For information about the roles and user stories that this API specification supports, see OpenDI Roles and User Stories.  
[View Resource >>](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/)

tags.name: models
tags.description:
Endpoints for Causal Decision Models. Models are largely made up of [components](api/components.tag.mdx).

## Roles

Endpoints for CDMs will are relevant for software targeting many common DI roles, some of which are listed below.

- [Decision Model Builders](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Model%20Builder/) may use these endpoints to share models and components that they have authored, to receive model components that they wish to incorporate, etc.
- [Decision Asset Managers](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Asset%20Manager/) may use these endpoints to provide access to curated libraries of CDMs and other DI Assets.
- [Decision Simulation Builders](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Simulation%20Builder/) may use these endpoints to access and analyze CDMs to prepare them for simulation.

tags.name: components
tags.description:
Endpoints for model diagram and runnable model components used in Causal Decision Models. Components include [Diagrams](./retrieve-a-diagram-component) and [Runnable Models](./retrieve-a-runnable-model-component).

## Roles

Endpoints for CDM components are relevant for software targeting many common DI roles, some of which are listed below.

- [Decision Model Builders](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Model%20Builder/) may use these endpoints to share model components that they have authored.
- [Decision Asset Managers](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Asset%20Manager/) may use these endpoints to provide access to curated libraries of CDM components and other DI Assets.

tags.name: simulations
tags.description:
Endpoints for simulation configurations, for simulating Causal Decision Models.

## Roles

Endpoints for simulation configurations are relevant for software targeting simulation-related DI roles, some of which are listed below.

- [Decision Simulation Builders](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Simulation%20Builder/) may use these endpoints to edit and share simulation configurations to be run on [Processors](api/processors.tag.mdx), to generate [Results](api/results.tag.mdx).

tags.name: results
tags.description:
Endpoints for simulation results, from simulated Causal Decision Models.

## Roles

Endpoints for simulation results are relevant for software targeting simulation-related DI roles, some of which are listed below.

- [Decision Simulation Managers](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Simulation%20Manager/) may use these endpoints to send and receive results from simulations they have previously run on [Processors](api/processors.tag.mdx).
- [Decision Monitors](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Monitor) may use these endpoints in the process of comparing simulation results to ongoing monitored decision models.

tags.name: processors
tags.description:
Endpoints for processors, representing compute resources used for simulating Causal Decision Models.

## Roles

Endpoints for processors are relevant for software targeting simulation-related DI roles, some of which are listed below.

- [Decision Simulation Managers](http://opendi.org/roles-user-stories/Roles/Decision%20Simulation%20Manager/) may use these endpoints to manage compute resources in the process of running simulations, to generate [Results](api/results.tag.mdx).

get.description:
Find a model by its UUID. Returns a reduced model JSON, with runnable models and diagrams given as a list of IDs.

For runnable model and diagram retrieval, see:  
- [/runnables/{runnableId}](api/retrieve-a-runnable-model-component.api.mdx)
- [/diagrams/{diagramId}](api/retrieve-a-diagram-component.api.mdx)

delete.description: Removes the model with the given UUID from the database.

get.description: Find a model by its UUID. Returns the complete model JSON, including all runnable models and diagrams.

Get a list of model components (diagrams and runnable models) the user has permission to access.

Results include all types of components, marked with a `componentType` field:

- `diagram`: See [Retrieve a Diagram](./retrieve-a-diagram-component)
- `runnable`: See [Retrieve a runnable model](./retrieve-a-runnable-model-component)

**NOTE: This proposed endpoint is an aggregate collection, returning a list of instances from multiple resource types.**  
We're not yet sure if this is a good idea! If you have thoughts or feedback about common functionality that would justify this sort of aggregate collection, talk to us about it!
